page.title: 13NURSING HOMES
page.content: Whitehanger is on a hill at Marley Lane. It is called a Hanger because it is at the top of a hill. It was built in 1907-1908 by Sir Aaron Moore and became a nursing home in 1940. It has 80 old people and around 60 staff. They have enlarged it to have more old people. The nursing home has 53 acres of garden . It is a very big nursing home. Valewood House, another nursing home in the area, consists of 17 staff for 23 old people. It has been a home since 1982. Among other activities the old folk go on picnics, dancing, knitting, sewing, art and flower arranging. Most of the people in the home come from this area, although some come from London.
